body:
### Summary

See: https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/8066#discussion_r189062850

If you install a package and remove the version from it's definition. In some cases uninstalling it will produce a `NoURLError`. This does not always occur (the link mentions a case where it does).

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install foo@2.1
# Remove version 2.1 from foo's package definition
$ spack uninstall foo@2.1
```

### Information on your system

This should be repeatable across all platforms without any special configuration.
title: Cannot uninstall package without url
